H2.text: A carrot is a first-level consumer in an ecosystem.

H3.text: Rabbit is a first‑level consumer, feeding directly on producers in the food chain.

A4.text: Herbivores eat plants and are called primary consumers.

A5.text: Plants and algae make their own food and are called producers.

A7.text: The wolf is mainly a carnivore and feeds on large wild hooved mammals as well as smaller animals, livestock, carrion, and garbage.

A8.text: Wolves also consume some plant material. In Europe, they eat apples, pears, figs, melons, berries and cherries.

A9.text: Hawks feed on a variety of smaller animals such as snakes, lizards, fish, mice, rabbits, squirrels, birds, or any other type of small game that is found on the ground.
